title: Extra Helpers for officer
text: goal officerExtras provide helper convenience functions officer package.

title: Extra Helpers for officer
text: can install development version officerExtras like :

title: Extra Helpers for officer
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(officerExtras)  docx <- read_docx_ext(filename = "example.docx", path = system.file("doc_examples", package = "officer"))  check_docx(docx)

what: Add an xml string or paragraph of text at a specified position in a Word document — add_to_body
title: Add an xml string or paragraph of text at a specified position in a Word document — add_to_body
text: Wrappers officer::body_add_par() officer::body_add_xml() use cursor_docx() helper functions allow input filename path use multiple options cursor placement. add_text_to_body() passes value glue::glue() add support glue string interpolation. add_gt_to_body() converts gt tables OOXML gt::as_word(). pos = NULL, add_to_body() calls officer::body_add() instead officer::body_add_par().

title: Add an xml string or paragraph of text at a specified position in a Word document — add_to_body
code: add_to_body(   docx,   keyword = NULL,   id = NULL,   index = NULL,   value = NULL,   str = NULL,   pos = "after",   ... )  add_text_to_body(   docx,   value,   style = NULL,   pos = "after",   .na = "NA",   .null = NULL,   .envir = parent.frame(),   ... )  add_xml_to_body(docx, str, pos = "after", ...)  add_gt_to_body(docx, gt_object, pos = "after", ...)  add_value_with_keys(docx, value, ..., .f = add_text_to_body)  add_str_with_keys(docx, str, ..., .f = add_xml_to_body)

title: Add an xml string or paragraph of text at a specified position in a Word document — add_to_body
text: docx rdocx object. keyword, id keyword string used place cursor officer::cursor_reach() bookmark id officer::cursor_bookmark(). Defaults NULL. keyword id provided, gt object inserted front document. index integer matching doc_index value appearing summary docx object created officer::docx_summary(). index paragraph value, text pargraph used keyword. value object add document. Supported objects vectors, data.frame, graphics, block formatted paragraphs, unordered list formatted paragraphs, pretty tables package flextable, 'Microsoft' charts package mschart. str wml string pos add new element relative cursor, one "", "", "". ... Additional parameters passed officer::body_add() officer::body_add_xml(). style paragraph style name. names available function styles_info names Word styles defined base document (see argument path read_docx). .na [character(1): ‘NA’] Value replace NA values . NULL missing values propagated, NA result cause NA output. Otherwise value replaced value .na. .null [character(1): ‘character()’] Value replace NULL values . character() whole output character(). NULL NULL values dropped (paste0()). Otherwise value replaced value .null. .envir [environment: parent.frame()] Environment evaluate expression . Expressions evaluated left right. .x environment, expressions evaluated environment .envir ignored. NULL passed, equivalent emptyenv(). gt_object gt object converted OOXML string gt::as_word() passed add_xml_to_body() str parameter. Required add_gt_to_body(). .f function takes docx value parameter returns rdocx object. keyword parameter must also supported named TRUE. Defaults add_text_to_body().

title: Add an xml string or paragraph of text at a specified position in a Word document — add_to_body
text: rdocx object added xml, gt tables, paragraphs text.

title: Add an xml string or paragraph of text at a specified position in a Word document — add_to_body
text: Using add_value_with_keys() add_str_with_keys() add_value_with_keys() supports value vectors length 1 longer. value named, names assumed keywords indicating cursor position adding value vector. value named, keyword parameter length value must provided. named = FALSE, keyword parameter required. Add add_str_with_keys() works identically uses str parameter .f defaults add_xml_to_body().

title: Check a docx summary data.frame — check_docx_summary
text: x data.frame object created officer::docx_summary(). n Required number rows. content_type Required content_type. ... Additional parameters passed cli::cli_abort() arg Argument name use error messages. Defaults caller_arg(x) call execution environment currently running function, e.g. call = caller_env(). corresponding function call retrieved mentioned error messages source error. need supply call throwing condition helper function relevant mention message. Can also NULL defused function call respectively display call hard-code code display. information error calls, see Including function calls error messages.

what:
Read a docx, pptx, potx, or xlsx file or use an existing object from officer
if provided — read_officer
title:
Read a docx, pptx, potx, or xlsx file or use an existing object from officer
if provided — read_officer
text: read_docx_ext(), read_pptx_ext(), read_xlsx_ext() wrappers read_officer() wrapper officer::read_docx(), officer::read_pptx(), officer::read_xlsx(). function uses filename path (original officer functions use path) default use rdocx, rpptx, rxlsx class object provided.

title:
Read a docx, pptx, potx, or xlsx file or use an existing object from officer
if provided — read_officer
code: read_officer(   filename = NULL,   path = NULL,   fileext = c("docx", "pptx", "xlsx"),   x = NULL,   arg = caller_arg(x),   quiet = TRUE )  read_docx_ext(filename = NULL, path = NULL, docx = NULL, quiet = TRUE)  read_pptx_ext(filename = NULL, path = NULL, pptx = NULL, quiet = TRUE)  read_xlsx_ext(filename = NULL, path = NULL, xlsx = NULL, quiet = TRUE)

title:
Read a docx, pptx, potx, or xlsx file or use an existing object from officer
if provided — read_officer
text: filename, path File name path. Default: NULL x rdocx, rpptx, rxlsx class object, docx provided, filename path ignored. Default: NULL quiet FALSE, warn docx provided filename /path also provided. Default: TRUE. docx, pptx, xlsx rdocx, rpptx, rxlsx class object passed x parameter corresponding function. Defaults NULL.

title:
Read a docx, pptx, potx, or xlsx file or use an existing object from officer

Arguments passed officer::set_doc_properties title,subject,creator,description text fields created date object values named list (names field names), element single character value specifying value associated corresponding field name. values provided, argument ... ignored.

title: Write a rdocx object to a docx file — write_docx
text: Returns rdocx input object (invisibly) writes rdocx object file name location matching path.
